ANSWER: Based on the diagnosis of infectious proctitis, likely gonococcal in origin, I recommend a comprehensive treatment approach that combines evidence-based medical management with patient-centered care strategies. The treatment plan includes administering intramuscular ceftriaxone 250 mg in a single dose along with oral azithromycin 1 g to cover possible co-infections. This strategy aims to effectively eradicate infection, prevent transmission, and promote patient well-being while minimizing complications and ensuring long-term STI management.
